Description: Fragment of oval handle to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine beige. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 124 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 143.)
Curator's comments: Name Teisamenos. Perhaps from the same die as a worn piece from Crododilopolis/Arsinoe, Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, KF570/1000570.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (276)
